headline: Broccoli and Tortellini Salad
description: Broccoli keeps very good company in this wonderful salad. There's fresh cheese tortellini, bacon, raisins, sunflower seeds, broccoli florets, red onion, and a sweet and sour mayonnaise dressing tossed in for good measure.
name: Broccoli and Tortellini Salad
recipeIngredient: 3 heads fresh broccoli, cut into florets

recipeInstructions.text: Place bacon in a large, deep skillet. Cook over medium high heat until evenly brown. Drain, crumble and set aside.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook tortellini in boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes or until al dente. Drain, and rinse under cold water.
In a small bowl, mix together mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar to make the dressing.
In a large bowl, combine broccoli, tortellini, bacon, raisins, sunflower seeds and red onion. Pour dressing over salad, and toss.

review.reviewBody: This is very good and was easy to throw together. It is sweet, so if you don't like your broccoli salad sweet, decrease the sugar a little. I made extra "dressing" because I like a little more sauce. It tastes even better the next day.
No sunflower seeds and big bites of onions. Yummy

This salad was okay. I followed the recipe and the dressing came out very thin and watery. I drained the tortellini and the broccoli pretty well. The dressing had a good taste to it but overall it was disappointing.
Easy and delicious! Just the way I like it!

This recipe is excellent. This was easy to make. I read all of the reviews and reduced the sugar by three quarters because I don’t really like sweet foods. Next time I will make double the sauce. I would like extra. It was still really good even though I only marinated it for an hour.
I make this all the time and LOVE it! Great for pot lucks and BBQs too
I made this as written but there was not enough dressing so I made 1/2 of the dressing recipe again. Next time I will double the dressing.

I usually don’t review when i don’t follow the recipe. I don’t like raisins and don’t have sunflower seeds but it wasn’t necessary as this salad was awesome without them. I will try to remember sunflower seeds next time i make it.

Used fresh red grapes vs raisins
Dressing was too sweet so I added Miracle whip to the original amount - it was not enough dressing anyway.

Really love this salad. I strain out the tortellini into the colander and rinse, then dump my chopped broccoli into the already boiling water, count to 30 and drain and rinse quickly. Beautiful bright green and easy peasy! This really is delicious!

Really love this salad. I strain out the tortellini into the colander and rinse, then dump my chopped broccoli into the already boiling water, count to 30 and drain and rinse quickly. Beautiful bright green and easy peasy! This really is delicious!
Have already made this twice exactly as written. Everyone has loved it. I put this one in my favorites.
I doubled the dressing and glad I did. Very good salad easy. I will make this one again
Soooo tasty! I made it with spinach tortellini and craisins and skipped the onion. I used a raspberry vinaigrette. I used fresh baby broccoli which was lovely too.

WAY too much sugar. I halved it initially and it was still way way too sweet. We really liked the mixture though so I'll probably make it again and only put 1/8 cup of sugar in...
Will definitely follow the suggestions of others and blanch the broccoli next time. Also omitted the onion.
A hearty side that was a hit with my family. Next time I will make extra dressing to moisten leftovers.
Made the recipe as is, minus the sunflower seeds for my preference. Delicious!

This was very good! I eliminated the sugar entirely and it was perfectly good without. Out of personal preference I sautéed the red onion in olive oil and used craisins instead of raisins. My family and I will make this again!
i did double the dressing and made it a day ahead as suggested by other cooks. i will definitely make it again.
I make this all the time for a summer meal, or pot lick! Always a big hit. Yum yum!!

I prep my salads into mason jars. I layered the salads in this order: coleslaw dressing, grape tomatoes, broccoli, tortellini, bacon, green onions, dried cranberries, raisins, and pumpkin seeds. I was hoping to add a spinach mix on top, but ran out of room. This pasta salad is the perfect mix of salty and sweet.
I made it and took it to a retiree meeting and it went over so big that everyone was asking for the recipe.
This was amazing!!!! I made it for Christmas, I forgot the bacon and still all 25 people at my house that day could not get enough. Will definitely be making this dish again!!!

I've made this recipe at least 6 or 7 times in several variations. The original recipe is good but I found that using southern style coleslaw dressing instead of the mayo/sugar/vinegar dressing is better (and even easier). Sometimes I use peas instead of broccoli but when I do use broccoli I found that blanching it is best.

I have made this wonderful dish more than a dozen times, and probably closer to 2 dozen times. Always a big favorite! I always send them to AllRecipes.com and this recipe. I have wanted to say thank you for posting this for a long time! My tip if you make this often, is to bake the whole package of bacon on a cookie sheet(s), then drain, set strips on paper towels. Separate strips into 4 batches with paper towels and fold up each into a container for freezing.
I cut recipe in half. My husband and I ate as a main course. I will make it again.
We did not like this recipe. it was too sweet and I used only half of the sugar.
I doubled the dressing as other suggested. Came out great! Cut down on the onions.
This is a great make ahead dish especially great in summer

I adjusted the serving size and made this for 300 people at my church. People request it often and we make it for our volunteers every 5 weeks as it's a favorite. I didn't change a thing. Everyone loved the sweetness of it. It was perfect with out any changes at all.
Such a great recipe!!! Absolutely loved it! Made as written except subbed Splenda for sugar. Yum!

Recipe has possibilities, but I wasn't totally happy with the dressing. Thinking I might try ranch dressing in the future. I can't eat sunflower seeds, so I omitted them. Steamed the broccoli for 10 minutes before adding. Also added some grape tomatoes.

This is a wonderful recipe and it is always a hit at any function I take it to. Although, I use dried cranberries instead of raisins. Yes I make extra dressing and cut back on the sugar. Sometimes I will add grape tomatoes cut into. For me I can eat this for a meal and nothing else.. Excellent.

I have tried this recipe again and again. Absolutely love it. I definitely know MIRACLE WHIP will NOT work with this (so gross). I've made it with broccoli in and out. Even substituted cashews for a different nutty taste. Any way you go this is a great recipe and makes plenty for pot luck events...
Love it! I add more bacon. For the dressing I use 1 cup mayo, 1/2 cup sugar, and 1 tablespoon vinegar. I always skip the raisins.

This is an amazing recipe! it disappears whenever I make it! I do make a few minor changes though. I don't put in bacon (I'm a vegetarian) and I use craisins instead of raisins and slivered almonds instead of sunflower seeds. The color and flavor is simply perfect!
Yumm!

did it for lunch tomorrow. I didn't do the mayo, but just spooned over the chicken flavor better-than-boulion instead of sweet mayo. In fact, I sprinkled hemp seeds instead of cheese. and used green onions instead of red. It is really tasty and I'm glad I found this recipe. Otherwise the bag of broccoli and cauliflower would have gone to waste.
excellent - My bible study group - all wanted the recipe. I read the reviews and also doubled the dressing - plus I doubled the beacon, as everyone loves beacon!
I have made this dish countless times - and always get raving reviews. I also turn this into a meal-in-one dish by adding diced up grilled chicken!! Good for every season and any event!
First time making this recipe and it is delicious. I used green onion instead of red onion. Also added some Italian seasoning and left out the raisins. Loved it!
I made this for a potluck at work and people went crazy for it! I substituted sliced almonds for the sunflower seeds and omitted the bacon to make it vegetarian-friendly. Will definitely make again!
I know this kind of salad is popular with others, but I just don't like sugar in my salads. I left out the raisins, but it was still too sweet
Mmmm
This is a fantastic summer side...or entire meal for that matter! Currently making this for the third time in as many weeks! Thanks for sharing this excellent flavorful dish!

This broccoli salad is fantastic. I followed the advice of many reviewers before more me and I thank them all for their tips. 1) Only cooked the refrigerated tortellini for 2-3 mins. 2) Blanched the broccoli in super hot water for 1 minute. 3) Double the amount of salad dressing!!! This last bullet is imperative. I put half the dressing on the night before and the other half just before serving it. Also, add sugar to the dressing in baby steps (1 T. at a time) and then taste test it. I personally didn't add nearly the amount of sugar the recipe called for but that is just personal taste. I waited to add the sunflower seeds and the crumbled bacon to the salad until the last minute as well. I was worried that they would get soggy overnight and the crunchy texture is part of the salad's uniqueness in my opinion. This recipe went immediately into my favorite folder!! Thanks AMFC for sharing it!

This was just okay...I kept adding cider vinegar until the taste and consistency was just right, but the rest of the family didn't care for it. I enjoyed it, but being the lone saveur, I saved the dressing in a ziploc and the broccoli in a gladware, with the bacon in a snack size ziploc, so I can enjoy the rest at my leisure. Keeper for me, but not for my family.
This was a good recipe. I added salmon, sun dried tomato, olives instead of the other toppings and substituted may for olive oil and garlic dressing.

This broccoli salad was very good.There are many pantry ready ingredients which make this a go to dish for me.I also cut the sugar in half,used dried 3 cheese tortellini,frozen broccoli and added 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese.Thank you for such a great recipe.

I made this to bring to a Memorial Day cookout along with the blueberry and apple pecan pie from this site . I made the brocolli salad per directions except I bought sunflower seeds in the shell instead of the seeds so I substituted with chopped pecans. I would advise to use only 1/2 of the dressing made the night before and toss with the other half in the morning. Add bacon and nuts just before serving. I received raves and wanted the recipe. Will make many times more
Always a favorite at get together
My family hated this

This dish is a staple during the summer for cookouts. I usually triple the recipe for our family (I only double the broccoli, triple everything else) because people love this stuff so much. The only thing I change is to omit the raisins and sunflower seeds and add in sliced almonds. I do not blanch the broccoli as others have, I love the crisp crunch against the soft tortellini. I also follow the tortellini cooking instructions since I use frozen and only cook about 3-5 minutes. I have even made this and added in some sliced up grilled chicken and made this a main dish. Simply love this recipe!

I love this recipe, but I need to cut back on calories. In order to reduce calories, I use turkey bacon and substitute no fat mayonnaise and use bow tie pasta in place of the cheese tortellini. I also prefer dried cranberries to raisins. Both of my daughter-in-laws have requested the recipe. There are no leftovers.

HUGE hit as a side dish on Easter. I followed the directions exactly. One thing I would have done differently is follow another's suggestion to blanche the broccoli a bit for a softer texture so that it could absorb the dressing a little.

This was a great recipe. I blanched the broccoli for 30 seconds exactly. Any longer and it would have been too soft. The blanching really brought out the beautiful green in the broccoli. After blanching, I soaked the florets in ice water. Per another suggestion, I made 1.5 times the dressing, added 1/3 of it right after I made the salad. Placed everything in a Ziploc in the fridge for a few hours and before I served it, I added the remaining dressing. I didn't 1.5 times the sugar in the dressing but kept it at 1/2 a cup sine I don't like things super sweet. I also needed to add some salt to the salad after I made it and it could be because I didn't salt the water enough when I cooked the tortellini. I also only used 1/4 of a purple onion. it seems like a whole one would have been too much and it could be because the onion I had was on the larger size. Everyone complimented me and it was all gone! This is going to be my new go-to potluck dish!
Great dish, but make sure it is all gobbled up the day you make it because it doesn't make much of a leftover.
Mmmm. Loved this! A big hit at our potluck. Something tasty and different from the usuals.

Good recipe- I followed this recipe without reading any of the comments making a few health conscientious changes. I used light mayo, splenda instead of sugar, 50% less sugar dried cranberries instead of raisins and 5 heads of broccoli. I used the same amount of dressing. Turned out very well and not nearly as heavy as the original recipe. Next time I think I will blanch the broccoli as recommended by others!
I had the chance to try this amazing salad recently, minus the red onion, plus dried cranberries. It. Was the best dish on the table!

Lovely recipe that I modified slightly. Used 20oz of the dry tortellini and blanched the broccoli in the pasta water at the end of cooking for 2mins. Used 3/4 cup mayo with 1/4 cup sugar and 3TBLS of cider vinegar. Mixed a the dressing, veggies,pasta and craisins together and chilled over night. Mixed in the bacon and seeds right before serving to my co-workers that loved it. What little that was left tasted even better the next day!! Thank you AMFC
Way too much sugar. All that sugar turns this into a dessert and it loses all its nutrients from the broccoli. Cut that sugar down and you'll be good to go.

I ordered a version of this salad from a local deli and loved it. So, I came on allrecipes to try to find a similar recipe. Thank goodness I did...I could eat this salad for breakfast, lunch and dinner! For the dressing I mixed 1/2 cup of miracle whip, 1/2 cup regular mayo, and 1/4 cup sugar (which is plenty of sugar--you could easily get away with using even less than 1/4 cup). I prefer to use golden raisins. Also, I think it is best if you cut up the broccoli into small bite size pieces (only using the florets and omitting the stem/stalk). Absolutely my favorite! Thanks for the recipe!

AWESOME!! Tweeked it a bit. Used 2 cups of the dry tortellini and I left out the sunflower seeds. Per the other reviews I blanched the broccoli. I used 3/4 cup mayo, 1/3 cup sugar and 3 teaspoons cider vinegar. A definite keeper and will be making it again for Memorial Day weekend!!

It's good, but unless you just want to rot your teeth and get extra calories without any added nutrition it doesn't need all that sugar. I put in half the amount in the recipe and it was still a little too sweet for me. Next time I will make it with 1/4 the amount of sugar.

I love broccoli salad, and this one with the pasta is so good! I can make it as a complete dinner, and my husband (who is not crazy about veggies) always goes back for seconds. If I am short on time, I use Lite Italian dressing instead of the sugar and vinegar; that tastes almost the same. We do leave the raisins out, as neither of us like them. Very good!
Doubled the recipe for large party. Instead of using 2 pkgs of Tortellini I substituted one of the pkg with that colorful macaroni. Everyone loved it!!

This is an excellent salad, could also be a good side dish. Make sure not to overcook the tortellini.

Ann really likes this, so I upped the rating to a '5'. Don't serve this cold - let it warm to room temperature, she suggests.
do exactly as said, double the dressing

Good idea, but the dressing is too sweet for the cheese-filled tortellini in my opinion. I did follow others' suggestions and mixed with about half of the dressing, decided the sweet dressing didn't work, so finished with ranch dressing instead. Family gathering enjoyed it.

I make this every time we have a potluck at work and there are never any leftovers! I took an earlier suggestion of making 1 1/2 times the sauce and adding the remaining half right before serving. I always have copies of the recipe with me whenever I bring this dish because I am always being asked for it!

If you chop the broccoli fine enough, that will be sufficient and gives a little crunch to the salad. Use toasted sunflower seeds. I also use red seedless grapes cut in half, when available, in place of raisens--such a nice summer salad.
I eat this often each week. Just love it.
tasted like coleslaw, not a fan
Love this salad and I make it all the time. I reduce the sugar a little bit but only a personal preference.
I made this salad for a large group. Everyone loved it. Only complaint was not enough dressing. For me the dressing was to sweet. i added less sugar and more red wine vinegar.
I LOOK for reasons to make this party-sized salad. I have friends request it, and I have shared the recipe many times. Great summer salad, or for a potluck anytime of year.

Great recipe and a little more elegant than traditional pasta salad. I've made it twice--once for a baby shower and another time for a jewelry party. I also added crasins instead of raisins and omitted the onion. The boxed/bagged tortellini is just as good as the fresh version.
This came out good. A little heavy for my taste. served for teriyaki burgers

I cannot get enough of this dish. Not only is it a great way to use up all of your leftover ingredients, but it's easy too! Tasty to eat both hot and cold. My husband and I have this as an entree, however it would be perfect as a side dish for those summer picnics.
The family loved this!!! I opted out of the raisins & sunflower seeds, and used white onion instead....it was gone quickly!! Made a perfect lunch for both kiddo and husband!

Had a package of tortellini I wanted to use up along with some broccoli. This was a very good combination. I added the broccoli to the last 2 minutes of the boiling tortellini water to make the green "pop" in color. I would do this again. Make your dressing up ahead of time so that the sugar has time to melt into the mayonnaise, stirring often. I used all the ingredients, but changed the order a little bit. After the dressing was well blended, about an hour I added it to the salad, withholding the sunflower seeds and bacon. I added those right before serving because I wanted them to still have some crunch. Good salad and would make it again.

Loved this stuff! Made as directed except doubled dressing (tho only a little more than 1/2 c sugar - that was plenty sweet). Also saved about 1/4 of the dressing to be added when serving. Next time would do only 1/2 of a red onion; even tho I really like onion, this much was too dominate. Added bacon and seeds when I added the final bit of dressing about 6 hrs later.

Made this up for a family gathering, and it went over pretty well. I cut back on the sugar and thought it was still slightly too sweet. I'm not sure if I would make it again, it just didn't "do it" for me.
I didn't have sunflower seeds on hand, so I used slivered almonds- It was delicious!

I brought this to a potluck and it was a huge hit! I followed other reviewers tips and blanched the broccoli and onion for 2 minutes, divided the raisins into half raisins and craisins, toasted the sunflower seeds and cut the sugar in half. I also added a head of broccoli, cut the cider vinegar in half and doubled the amount of dressing. I couldn't find dry tortellini in the store so I used fresh and it worked out perfectely. Thank you for this recipe I will definitely be making this again!
Made this for a baby shower and it was simply wonderful. I did follow a few suggestions and made the salad the day before with 1/2 the dressing. Simply Amazing!

Delicious! Make sure to cook the tortellini al dente and blanch the broccoli in the boiling tortellini water to save on time. I omitted the onions and raisins but kept everything else the same. Yummy!

I tried this because I like the classic broccoli salad - and this is it pretty much but with tortellini - and thought this would be more like a main dish. I didn't care for the addition of the tortellini but I'm sure that's just a personal preference. I think it was because 'sweet' is good with all of the other ingredients but I didn't care for sweet tortellini.
LOVED IT. First time I made it. It's easy. Took it to work and first to go!!!

Loved, loved, loved this. Had it again for lunch today. I used tricolored tortellini for appearance but any cheese tortellini no matter what color would not take away from this salad. My wife says we have a winner... which means NO MORE macaroni and Miracle Whip salads in the summer... Can I hear an AMEN!
Finally found the recipe that I've been looking for. My family couldn't get enough of this. I did omit the sunflower seeds and substituted cashews and it still was delicious!

Potluck favorite everytime! People always ask for the recipe. I play with the additions of things like dried cherries or glazed walnuts, etc. and the end result is always an empty bowl on the table and people asking for more.
This has got to be one of my all time favorite recipes!! I will be making this at all family gatherings, I ate the left overs for three days for lunch and wish I had more!
I used Dried Cranberries to replace the raisins, and Grapeseed Oil Veganaise instead of Mayonnaise. It was SO delicious!
This was good, but I used regular spiral noodles instead of the cheese Tortellini and added chunks of cheese and ham!

Awesome salad. I follow the recipe expect use frozen brocolli I let thaw out for a little while, then blanch them. Makes it just a little quicker. A little extra dressing is great too!! Love this recipe.

A huge hit! I did use less than 1/4c sugar, 3/4c mayo and 2Tbsp. cider vinegar, we mixed everything but the pasta and bacon and left sitting for a few hours; then added the last two before serving. It was perfect for my family; the girls devoured the broccoli "trees".
Very Good. A relative brought it a family gathering and told me to get the recipe from allrecipes.com. I have made it several times and all have like it.
